summary: Most frontend Valentine single-page UI and interactions (gradient background, centered card, YES success view, NO moving + GIF/message cycling, image fallback) are implemented in App.tsx with Tailwind theme additions. However, the required static asset saesha.jpg is not shown as added, and unrequested authentication/actor infrastructure and an empty backend canister were introduced despite non-goals/constraints.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add the top card image as a static frontend asset named exactly "saesha.jpg" and render it with the same presentation.
missing_requirements.reason: The UI references "/saesha.jpg" and includes an onError fallback, but the diff summary does not show the actual static asset file "saesha.jpg" being added anywhere (e.g., frontend/public/saesha.jpg).

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity authentication context/provider and related hooks added to the frontend.
hallucinated_features.reason: User accounts/authentication (Internet Identity) is explicitly a non-goal, but the diff adds an InternetIdentityProvider and related hook code, and wraps the app with it.

hallucinated_features.description: Actor creation hook and React Query wiring for backend actor access.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by any REQ; also implies backend interaction and identity-based actor creation, which is outside the single-page frontend Valentine experience requirements.

hallucinated_features.description: Added an (empty) Motoko backend canister actor.
hallucinated_features.reason: Backend is "only if needed"; the Valentine page requirements are purely frontend and do not require a backend. An empty actor was added anyway.
